item.description: Jan Middendorp‚Äôs Dutch Type is truly a magnificent book. I would go so far as to call it the best looking book on typography that I own. If you can get a copy, don‚Äôt hesitate. Gorgeous.
Final Inktober image for today.
The constraint for Inktober this year is the number of pens I‚Äôm using and the size of paper, which are these super cheap postcards from Muji (12 for less than a dollar).
I know I‚Äôm super late to Inktober this year, but better late than never.
I can finally declare Autumn/Winter has begun here in Dubai. It‚Äôs been a really long summer so hoping to make full advantage of the good weather this year.

My wife is forever loosing her iPhone. Top tip. If you login from another device on iCloud (and assuming the phone is still got power and connected to the internet) you can cause it to ring, even if it‚Äôs put on mute. So awesome.

item.title: Phones and Cameras
item.description:
After listen to The Minimalists on the Kevin Rose show, I came to a realisation. In my persuit to determine which iPhone I should be buying this year, it turns out I really don‚Äôt need to get one after all.

The reason for upgrading isn‚Äôt because the phone is slow, lacks some essential feature or that certain apps don‚Äôt run on it. Rather the only reason to upgrade is for the camera.

Except I already own a pretty decent camera, the NEX-F3. I bought it just before Zane was born (so a little over 4 years ago now) and seem to have stopped using it 2 years ago. Why? I‚Äôm not sure. Maybe I bought into the whole ‚Äòthe best camera is the one on you‚Äô ideaology?

A quick read of a Wirecutter article I bookmarked in 2013, led me to circling onto several Sigma lens that will help me get better photos. The bonus to all this is that they‚Äôre at a pretty reduced price point at the moment. And while we‚Äôre here, we might as well talk about one of my favourite article about photography to brush up on some things.

Netflix has seriously changed how I consume some of my entertainment. Thankfully Better Call Saul isn‚Äôt on that network which means I have to wait for a new episode every week. Somehow gives my week a little bit of relief as it‚Äôs the only show I‚Äôm watching these days.

I stumbled upon a truly incredible graph today that showed all the various types of Photovoltaic panel technology and their efficiency progress mapped across the years. What‚Äôs astounding is the innovation that is happening in this space, showing where the future will be.
Happy Inktober everyone. I‚Äôm hoping to dip my toe this year and have an idea of what to do, hopefully ready with a few things to share.

Everything old is new again. New faces in the office as our team slowly continues it‚Äôs transformation. I‚Äôm obviously aware (sometimes painfully) that nothing in life stays the same. When life kicks your ass, first tidy everything up and then assess and review.

Finally got the bluetooth in my car sorted out. It‚Äôs only taken a couple of years and $100 to get it sorted. I‚Äôll never understand why Audi don‚Äôt enable this simple feature to begin with but there you have it. Now I can listen to my tunes through proper speakers.
It‚Äôs getting easier to draw these scenes. The funny thing being that once I gave up on drawing comics I‚Äôve allowed myself to draw these types of things.

Ok I‚Äôve not bought any new Field Notes in a year. I still have a healthy stash and could easily remain stocked up for several years to come‚Ä¶.however these Ram edition are really testing my Field Notes abstinence.
These three F1 2021 concepts as revealed on the F1 website show a future of motosport that looks exciting. They‚Äôre also meant delivers to deliver closer driving and wheel to wheel action.

Rough couple of days. Zane caught something from school, which he gave to me, which I gave to the wife. The joys of a new school year I guess and all the delightful viruses that are given the opportunity to jump from one child to the other. Good news is it‚Äôs nearly over.
Not one but two great additions to iAWriter. Which reminds me that I need to take a deep dive into the Shortcuts app as soon as possible.
Complet-ish but un-used art for my upcoming project. It was too busy for what I‚Äôm going for.
My favourite feeling these days is that moment I step into the house, after work, and my boy Ryan is genuinely happy and excited to see me. It never lasts very long so I‚Äôm cherishing these moments.
Was hoping to get the Hobonichi Weeks Mega this year. Sadly out of stock, 17 days after launch!

So when we bought the Q5 2 1/2 years ago what I didn‚Äôt realise was that although bluetooth was available in the car, Audi had decided that it would restrict where. Specifically music couldn‚Äôt stream that way. It‚Äôs taken me this long to resolve the issue with an overpriced dingus.

Following up from my previous post, sometimes you need some bad sleep for you to work out what‚Äôs already in your head. Ryan decided not to sleep tonight, but my brain kicked into overdrive this morning and I‚Äôve settled on the style I‚Äôm trying to achieve. LOTS of art to come!

Well that didn‚Äôt go as planned. I‚Äôve been working on a piece of art for my new project all weekend and completed 85%. When I finally had a look at it in it‚Äôs intended medium (email), I realised it was too busy and complicated. Back to the drawing board I guess.
Because one sketch deserves another‚Ä¶
More sketches.
It‚Äôs iPhone X, or iPhone XS day! After 4 years I think I‚Äôm finally due for an upgrade.
First attempt at using my new style with architectural style backgrounds - always the intention really.
Learning how to draw and sketch in ways different to what I‚Äôm used to. First up, cars!

Fell down a massive hole that is Udemy. Never heard of it before and stumbled on it by accident while looking for resources for sketching like an architect. Found a great course and then proceeded to buy a whole bunch more.

üé• So the wife and I finally watched a movie together. We settled on Tully. Great movie. It will hit different people in different ways. It hit my wife the hardest being a mother of a 4 year old and 8 month old. Diablo Codi is one of my favourite writers in Hollywood.

üáØüáµ Hadn‚Äôt realised the extent of the destruction on Japan this summer. I have a huge soft spot in my mind and heart for the country. I truly wish them the best in what seems to be a never ending assault of natural disasters.

So the new upload function on Micro.blog is pretty awesome. Especially considering it works for gifs as well. The new Maus from Lofree is another design win from a company who‚Äôs really been killing it as bringing 1950s stylings to modern technology.
So I discovered Tadama today. Probably the most elegant and simple pomodoro app on the Mac.

üèÄ A month ago I went to the basketball court and nearly died from the humidity. Which idiot decides to go play bball when it‚Äôs 95% humidity? This idiot. Anyway, today attempted the same thing again and can happily confirm that the worst is behind us and it‚Äôs now bball weather.
Ok someone tell me why it‚Äôs taken this long for someone (thanks bro) to tell me about The Weeknd and the Starboy album? You‚Äôre welcome, pass on the love.
Use the negative energy you have to build something rather than mope around.
Everything is a remix. This article on the inspiration behind Monument Valley‚Äôs levels is a great peak inside the process.

So now that Sunlit 2.2 has been released, I‚Äôm considering jettisoning myself from Instagram. The only missing feature for me is the ability to my photos as a collection of thumbnails (in the app or online). Hopefully that will come in future iterations.

I just read Khaled Hosseini‚Äôs Sea Prayer, and honestly haven‚Äôt cried this much since Alan Kurdi‚Äôs image was burned into my head. My oldest was roughly the same age. The whole thing just breaks my brain and emotions in countless ways.
UGhhh. Came back to my car, parking sensor in the rear had popped in. Need to find a way to pull this thing back in place without removing the whole rear bumper‚Ä¶YouTube?

Yesterday I asked for an alternative to Tinyletter and Buttondown was recommended. Having spent a day kicking the tires, this now joins a small pantheon of indie web services that I want to support. Need an email service that can join Pinboard, Micro.blog, Feedbin and Buttondown.

Does anyone have a suggestion for a good alternative to Tinyletter, that is similar in minimal functionality but is possibly paid? I‚Äôm having trouble sorting something out there and I‚Äôve read that eventually MailChimp will be closing the service down‚Ä¶

Affinity Publisher Beta is out today! I‚Äôve been waiting for a long time for this. With both Photo and Designer becoming my go to apps for digital creative work, this is the last piece of the puzzle. So excited.

Finally pressed the trigger on a particular part of my latest project - this is a long term endeavour but it begins with this very small step. I‚Äôll be hammering through some details over the weekend and hopefully try and release it out into the big bad world soon.

Paul turned me onto Russell Brand‚Äôs podcast Under The Skin. I‚Äôm halfway through episode 03 with Adam Curtis and have the same feeling I do when I get through an issue of the Economist. Even Brand‚Äôs accent (not a fan) can‚Äôt hide the smartness and thoughtfulness on display.

item.title: Plastic
item.description:
The plastic I use in my life is really starting to grate on me in a bad way. To me it signals a lack of progress, in many ways, for a race who excells at creating problems and then solving them. The latest episode of Hello Internet highlighted that we still have a long way to go.

In it CGP Grey claims that the UK government reviewed the impact of plastic bags when compared to other kinds of bags and that the cloth totes require 20,000 uses to become more sustainable. The document he was probably referring to was this one here, from the executive summary a very handy table is given:

Type of carrier HDPE bag (No secondary reuse) HDPE bag (40.3% reused as bin liners) HDPE bag (100% reused as bin liners) HDPE bag (Used 3 times)
Paper bag 3 4 7 9
LDPE bag 4 5 9 12
Non-woven PP bag 11 14 26 33
Cotton bag 131 173 327 393

Sure, still a decent number of times that each type of bag needs to be reused, but a far cry from 20,000. I certainly use my bags at least 100 times a year, and have had them for 3 1/2 years so far‚Ä¶.they could last for many many years to come.

The full Hobonichi Techo 2019 lineup is now live. I‚Äôm going for the Weeks Mega (for work) and an A6 Planner for life. I tend to like having more space to write, but having dates actually keep me coming back to fill them more regularly, compared with my current setup.

It‚Äôs always a joy when I receive an email from Matthew Butterick - go subscribe if type is your thing. His online book has been revised and I‚Äôm seriously considering using Equity for my next major project.

After declaring tidy office bankrupcy, I‚Äôve managed to get back on track. I realised that I really need to Konmari the hell out of my office. Letting go of this stuff is the hardest but I know that it‚Äôs the ideal way to help gather my thoughts and focus my mind and attention.

Publii is a static-website-building tool. Scary rabbit hole to fall into. Looks exceptionally well polished and documented for an open source project that I‚Äôve never heard of. Also, the themes are excellent - Mercury for photos looks great.
